title.native: RDG レッドデータガール

description:
Shy 15-year-old Izumiko has a hard time making personal connections. Oddly, she can’t use computers or cell phones, either—they mysteriously crash when she touches them. When her childhood bully Miyuki shows up at the shrine where she was raised, their lives become involuntarily entwined. Izumiko learns she is the last vessel of a goddess—and Miyuki must serve as her dutiful guardian.

(Source: Crunchyroll)

Note: A modern fantasy based on Japanese Shinto legends.

node.description:
__Agency:__ I'm Enterprise

[Profile](https://www.imenterprise.jp/profile.php?id=74) | [Website](https://hayamisaoriofficial.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/hayami_official)  | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCtUcK6HrhD024CkPDsURBwg) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/hayamisaori_official/)

Member of the duet [Blue Drops](https://anilist.co/staff/106305/Blue-Drops) with [Hitomi Yoshida](https://anilist.co/staff/101088/Hitomi-Yoshida).

**Non-Anime Roles:**
- Elisanne (Dragalia Lost)
- Kamisato Ayaka (Genshin Impact)
- Munechika (Utawarerumono)
- Pramanix (Arknights)
- Rei Shijo (Princess Connect! Re:Dive)
- Tao Isonokami (Shin Megami Tensei V)
- Vector (Girls' Frontline)
- Shimakaze (Azur Lane)
- Kirifuji Nagisa (Blue Archive)
- Kunimitsu II (Tekken 7)
- Emma Millstein (The Legend of Heroes Series)
- Hulkenberg (Metaphor: ReFantazio)
- Caeda (Fire Emblem Heroes)
**Michiko Yokote** is a Japanese scriptwriter. She is the pupil of [Kazunori Itou](https://anilist.co/staff/97941).

[Blog](http://andante-d.way-nifty.com/blog/)

Noriko Ogiwara was born in 1959. Having read C. S. Lewis' Chronicles of Narnia at a very early age, she decided to become a fantasy writer.

Her first book, Sorairo Magatama won her several awards for children's literature and was translated into English by Cathy Hirano as Dragon Sword and Wind Child; the English version was out-of-print until it was re-released by Viz Media in October 2007. The two sequels, Hakuchou Iden and Usubeni Tennyo, have only been published in Japanese. The re-issuing of Dragon Sword and Wind Child encouraged Viz to publish the next novel in the sequence, Hakuchou Iden, as Mirror Sword and Shadow Prince in May 2011. These three books together are called The Jade Trilogy.

Another of her works is Nishi no Yoki Majo, a western-styled high fantasy series featuring a girl on the quest of finding out the mysteries surrounding the legends of her country and her friends. Nishi no Yoki Majo has been adapted into a manga series by Haruhiko Momokawa in Comic Blade, and licensed for English publication as The Good Witch of the West.

Her fantasy novel series Red Data Girl was first published in 2008, and was adapted into an anime television series.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/芝美奈子)

Noted for her character designs on [Black Butler](https://anilist.co/anime/4898/), [Noir](https://anilist.co/anime/272/), [Tegami Bachi](https://anilist.co/anime/6444/) among many others.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/篠原俊哉)

Frequent presence in [P.A. Works](https://anilist.co/studio/132/)' shows.

Masumi Itou is a singer and composer. Ito has composed the soundtracks to many anime television shows and is part of the bands Oranges & Lemons and Heart of Air. She graduated from Musashino College of Music, and her husband is music producer Yoshiyuki Ito.

Masumi Itou is a singer and composer. Ito has composed the soundtracks to many anime television shows and is part of the bands Oranges & Lemons and Heart of Air. She graduated from Musashino College of Music, and her husband is music producer Yoshiyuki Ito.

Masumi Itou is a singer and composer. Ito has composed the soundtracks to many anime television shows and is part of the bands Oranges & Lemons and Heart of Air. She graduated from Musashino College of Music, and her husband is music producer Yoshiyuki Ito.

Masumi Itou is a singer and composer. Ito has composed the soundtracks to many anime television shows and is part of the bands Oranges & Lemons and Heart of Air. She graduated from Musashino College of Music, and her husband is music producer Yoshiyuki Ito.

**Spouse:** [Shouichi Taguchi](https://anilist.co/staff/112059) (December 31, 2018-)

**[Website](http://annabel.jp/)** | **[Twitter](https://twitter.com/A_nnabel)** | **[Tumblr](https://annabel-annabel.tumblr.com/)** | **[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/a_nnabel318/)**

**Introduction:**
Annabel is a Japanese-Argentine singer-songwriter signed under the company Lantis. In regards to her personal life, most of her information was unknown, until she revealed her real name via a letter to a famous radio station. Her real given name was revealed to be the same as her artist name, which is Annabel.

**Biography:**
She began her music career in 2005. In 2006, Annabel and singer [Nagi Yanagi (やなぎなぎ)](https://anilist.co/staff/109637/Nagi-Yanagi) formed the unit [Binaria](https://open.spotify.com/artist/3SkdXeqJHKFNXuaHvrj1pL?si=CZChqP69S3O6Dw0TBvdI_w), to date, they have released 13 albums. In 2007, she formed another unit with the singer Bermel.Inazawa called anNina. As anNina, the duo performed the ending themes to the second and third seasons of *[Higurashi: When They Cry](https://anilist.co/anime/934/Higurashi-no-Naku-Koro-ni/)*, respectively named *[Higurashi: When They Cry Kai](https://anilist.co/anime/1889/Higurashi-no-Naku-Koro-ni-Kai/)* and *[Higurashi: When They Cry Rei](https://anilist.co/anime/3652/Higurashi-no-Naku-Koro-ni-Rei/)*. In 2009, she started her solo career as a singer-songwriter, under the name Annabel.

Due to her rise in popularity, she started performing theme songs for the animation industry (anime series). Her first solo was "[Anamnesis](https://anidb.net/song/48723)", which was used as the ending theme to the 2012 anime TV series *[Another](https://anilist.co/anime/11111/Another)*, the single for "Anamnesis" was released on February 8, 2012. Annabel released her second single "[Above Your Hand](https://anidb.net/song/51660)" on May 23, 2012, which was used as the ending theme song for the anime TV series *[Sankarea](https://anilist.co/anime/11499/Sankarea)*. Her third single "[Signal Graph](https://anidb.net/song/52397)", was released on July 25, 2012, which was used as the opening theme for the anime TV series *[Love, Elections & Chocolate](https://anilist.co/anime/12175/Koi-to-Senkyo-to-Chocolate)*. She released her first solo album *[Miniascape](https://anidb.net/collection/8616)* on November 28, 2012.

In 2015, she sang the vocals for the theme song of the 3DS game, 7th Dragon III Code:VFD, from the 7th Dragon series.

In 2016, she formed the band siraph with Masayuki Hasuo and Masaaki Yamasaki (whom are former [School Food Punishment](https://anilist.co/staff/102508/School-Food-Punishment) members) and Yoshimasa Terui (from the band haisuinonasa) who were a member of her backup band.

(Source: [en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Annabel_(Japanese_singer))

**Spouse:** [Shouichi Taguchi](https://anilist.co/staff/112059) (December 31, 2018-)

**[Website](http://annabel.jp/)** | **[Twitter](https://twitter.com/A_nnabel)** | **[Tumblr](https://annabel-annabel.tumblr.com/)** | **[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/a_nnabel318/)**

(Source: [en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Annabel_(Japanese_singer))

Illustrator mainly for light novels who first debuted in 2004.

Originating from [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/), currently affilaited with [P.A. Works](https://anilist.co/studio/132/).
Sister to [Colleen Clinkenbeard](https://anilist.co/staff/95472/)

The founder and former representative director of [Funimation](https://anilist.co/studio/102/).

**Non-anime roles:**
